data.title: Feoffment, 16 September [1554] (1) Thomas Lough, of Blencarn, Cumberland, gent. (2)...
data.meta_description: The official archive of the UK government. Our vision is to lead and transform information management, guarantee the survival of today's information for tomorrow and bring history to life for everyone.
data.text:
Feoffment, 16 September [1554]

(1) Thomas Lough, of Blencarn, Cumberland, gent.

(2) Nicholas Lough, son and heir of (1) and Elazabath [sic], wife of Nicholas.

Recital: Deed of 24 July [1554] with Richard Dudley, of Yanwath, esq.

Premises: All lands of (1) in Sebram [Sebergham] and Cumrew, Cumberland, and in Bolton, Westmorland, to (2) and their heirs.

Livery of seisin of lands in Sebram, 25 September 1554, witnessed by Richard Dudley, Anthony Middelton, Thomas Allis and Anthony Hedd, and lands in Bolton, 18 September 1554, witnessed by Richard Dudley, Thomas Byrkbek, John Alyn and John Spethyng.
